avalancheActivity.comment: As a consequence of the occasionally strong wind, fresh snow drift accumulations formed. These can be released by a single winter sport participant in particular on north, northeast and east facing slopes above approximately 2200 m. Caution is to be exercised at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind slabs represent the main danger.

snowpackStructure.comment: In some cases the wind slabs have bonded still only poorly with each other and the old snowpack. Over a wide area new snow and wind slabs are lying on soft layers. Individual weak layers exist in the snowpack on wind-loaded slopes. In particular at elevated altitudes snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind.

avalancheActivity.comment: As a consequence of the occasionally strong wind, the snow drift accumulations have increased in size. The avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls above approximately 2200 m and at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack. Wind slabs can be released, even by a single winter sport participant and reach large size in isolated cases.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind slabs are to be avoided as far as possible at intermediate and high altitudes.

snowpackStructure.comment: In some cases the wind slabs have bonded still only poorly with the old snowpack. At elevated altitudes snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind. At low altitude only a small amount of snow is lying for the time of year.

avalancheActivity.comment: As a consequence of northwesterly wind, sometimes avalanche prone wind slabs formed. The fresh wind slabs can be released by a single winter sport participant in some cases in particular on north to northeast to southeast facing aspects and generally at intermediate and high altitudes. The more recent wind slabs are to be bypassed in very steep terrain.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Fresh wind slabs at intermediate and high altitudes.

snowpackStructure.comment:
The snowpack will be well bonded below approximately 2000 m.
In isolated cases new snow is lying on a hard crust. In all regions only a small amount of snow is lying for the time of year.
